Chapter 7 - Inside the Walls.name: 第七章：探索德拉肯海姆内城

Chapter 7-Inside the Walls.name: 探索德拉肯海姆内城
Chapter 7-Inside the Walls.text:
第 7 章 : 探索
德拉肯海姆内城

巨大高耸的城墙将德兰河南北两侧的德拉肯海姆城区包围了起来。虽然有一段城墙已被陨石摧毁，但人们普遍认为这里残留的污染过于严重，因而无法通行。除此之外，整座城墙完好无损，冒险者和派系特工如果不通过五扇城门，则无法进入内城。

在城墙上有着许多巴洛克风格的建筑装饰。城垛上，狞笑着的恶魔雕像、爪子般锐利的尖刺装饰、龙形的雕塑，还有尽职尽责、长着翅膀的石像鬼正守卫着城墙的堞口。然而，这些怪异的雕像并不仅仅是装饰品。在德拉肯海姆还是一座生机勃勃的城市时，这些魔法守卫就能在君主的意志下焕发出生机。现在，它们转而为污霭中那股扭曲的异常意志服务，作为对保卫城市的最后指令的嘲弄，凶狠地袭击任何胆敢越过城墙的人！

总览

巨大高耸的城墙将德兰河南北两侧的德拉肯海姆城区包围了起来。虽然有一段城墙已被陨石摧毁，但人们普遍认为这里残留的污染过于严重，因而无法通行。除此之外，整座城墙完好无损，冒险者和派系特工如果不通过五扇城门，则无法进入内城。

  • 勇士门处于天火信众的控制之下。
  • 学院门现在被一道可怕的次元裂隙占据了。
  • 国王门现在被巨魔之王占领了。
  • 牧者门由覆影明灯守卫着。
  • 圣殿门现在成为了一支 @UUID[Actor.clmRXQkHQKqlO3R0] 军队的临时据点。

    • 玩家角色们需要自行决定是要清理干净这些地点，还是和盘踞于各城门的派系做个交易，亦或是采取其他手段。对手冒险者很快就会告诉角色们走下水道进城并不是明智之举，因为有更多更危险的怪物藏匿在那里。

    冒险引子

    角色们应当通过传言或自身经历充分了解到城墙的危险，并主动寻找穿越它的方法。在进入内城冒险前，城墙可以成为一个棘手的问题，而各派系的副官和首领都会指出，如果角色们掌握了一个可靠的进出城的方法，任何需要进入内城的任务都会变得轻松许多。

    圣殿门之战： 在战役的关键时刻，白银骑士团将发动一场重大攻势，从占领圣殿门的加米尔军团手中夺取城门。在这次联合行动中，他们将邀请玩家角色和其他派系一同合作。

    遭遇

    尝试穿越城墙的角色们可能会触发以下遭遇之一：

    戍墙石像鬼

    7 （[[/r 2d6]]） @UUID[Actor.nPZV2GKXoktLDu31]{戍墙石像鬼} （见怪物 附录 A） 会活化并攻击任何试图执行以下行为的角色：

  • 爬上城墙或塔楼至少一半的高度。
  • 飞入城墙周围水平距离 150 尺内的区域，或从任意高度试图飞越城墙。
  • 在城墙或塔楼周围徘徊超过 10 分钟。

    • @UUID[Actor.nPZV2GKXoktLDu31]{戍墙石像鬼}的攻击十分精准、凶狠且毫不留情。如果它们的猎物的生命值降至 0，它们就会在袭击下个目标前，将自己的下个回合用于撕碎这个生物的躯体。石像鬼会不计距离地追逐它们的猎物深入内城，直到它们的猎物被撕碎，除非这些角色离开城墙外超过 300 尺，它们才会放弃猎杀。但是，戍墙石像鬼不会攻击和一件德拉肯海姆信物 （见 附录 D） 同调了的角色。

    守塔巨龙

    敏锐的角色会注意到，在城墙和德兰河交汇的那一段城墙上没有设置任何阻碍物或守卫。并不是这一段城区没有设防，而是有两头 @UUID[Actor.NxVKmMdsfKoJEAJP]{守塔巨龙} （见 附录 A） 代替了石像鬼栖息于塔楼堡垒之上，它们会从河流的侧面袭击那些打算渡河进入城市的入侵者。它们采取的行动方针和上述的戍墙石像鬼类似。

    区域详述

    首先是城墙、塔楼和城门的一般特征，然后是各个城门的占据者的具体细节：

    城墙

    城墙： 石砌的城墙高 40 尺，厚 10 尺，城墙的垛口朝外设立。城墙上全部凿有屠坑和悬伸出墙的炮台，在城门附近的城墙上还有用于增加防御能力的木制围板或瓦顶。

    塔楼： 城墙每隔一段距离就建有高 60 尺、直径 30 尺的塔楼。有的在塔顶设有垛口，有的则有尖顶。每座塔上都装饰着一条雄伟的青铜龙。其中最大的塔楼位于城墙与德兰河的交汇处。

    门楼

    有五座碉堡状的门楼连通着城市内部。每座门楼都由两座高 60 尺、直径 40 尺的粗矮的塔堡组成。塔楼的两侧则是 15 尺宽的双吊闸城门。虽然几座门楼本身的结构大体相似，但目前的占据者却各不相同。

    每个门楼都有四层，每层高约 15 尺。外墙厚 4 至 5 尺。门楼内的地板是木制的，但中央的螺旋楼梯是石制的。门楼的箭缝只有数寸宽，可以为来自外部和下方的攻击提供四分之三掩护（+5 AC）。门楼的普通橡木门被锻铁加固，并配有厚重的锁和横杆。

    城门通道： 城门的通道大致宽 15 尺，高 25 尺，长 25 尺。通道两端各有一个锻铁打造的栅栏和用钢筋加固的巨大木门。城门可以通过拉动一根巨大的杠杆式拉杆到一个合适的位置来将其关上。

    塔楼楼梯： 每座塔的中央都有一个石制的螺旋阶梯。楼梯宽 5 尺，在每层都设有落脚点。

    地面层：其中一座塔堡的外墙上倚墙建有一个 10 尺高的旋转楼梯，通过楼梯上方的栅栏门就可以进入塔楼。从外部无法进入左侧塔楼的底层。这些房间通常被用作寝室或监狱。

    绞车层： 升起或降下城门需要一个小队通力合作，小队成员需要成功通过 4 个 DC 12 的力量检定，而当绞车被松开时，城门会猛然关闭。

    城垛层 此区域可以直接通过门进入。以城垛为掩体，对城墙下方进行射击的生物可以获得四分之三掩护的好处。

    塔垛： 此区域可以直接通过活板门进入。这里部署有弩炮、投石器或大炮。

    勇士门

    这座城门被陨石坠落时产生的碎片击中，导致其大部分结构已经坍塌。其中一座塔楼已经完全倒塌，并坠入下面的几座建筑里。城门本身已经变得四分五裂，支离破碎。整个通道里到处散落着大块的石头、建筑用石、碎木块以及其他碎屑、碎片和废弃物。在碎石之间被清理出一条细长的人行通道，而其中一座塔楼的通道已被清理至城门入口处。城门内有一个临时搭建起来的小营地，围绕着营地设有几个帐篷。这个营地就位于进入城门塔楼的唯一入口附近。二十余个天火信众正在这里休息和休养，之后他们就会继续他们的旅程。他们占据着这个小营地，有些人在塔楼内讨论、集会，或者为需要支援和治疗的伤员提供帮助。城门则由一位名叫伯曼·韦伯的天火 @UUID[Actor.JLIamINrQLGlBiPn]{牧师} 看守。

  • 在陨石坠落后，城门几乎完全倒塌，在此区域通行时视为困难地形 difficult terrain。
  • 城门周围的区域受到严重污染且被污霭覆盖。穿越城门的角色需要成功通过一个 DC 15 的体质豁免，否则将受到 10 （[[/r 3d6]]） 点暗蚀伤害并获得 1 级污染。
  • 所有驻扎在此的天火信众都已完成了圣礼，并对污染免疫。
  • 当有新的信徒朝圣经过这里时，他们会得到快速帮助和治疗，然后继续踏上前往陨石坑边缘的旅途。
  • 角色们在第一次通过这扇城门时， @UUID[Actor.tqJK1mzxPst0xV08] 也会出现在这里。她预见到他们的到来，并会和他们攀谈，邀请他们加入教会。
  • 在之后的任何时间，卢克雷蒂亚本人都有 50%的几率出现在这里，亲自迎接前来参加圣礼的新信徒，并会在知情的情况下在这里等待着角色们，请求他们加入天火教团。
  • 如果天火信众成为了角色们的敌人，卢克雷蒂亚·马西亚斯就不会再出现在这。
  • 城门由 5 名@UUID[Compendium.5e-monster-book.5e-guanmo.Actor.CeGORFhpLPuusfSQ]{邪教狂信者} 和 2 名@UUID[Compendium.5e-monster-book.5e-guanmo.Actor.pVizARtQTDxyOzuv]{狂战士} 看守着。剩下驻扎于此的天火信众都是@UUID[Compendium.5e-monster-book.5e-guanmo.Actor.4NuYFytVMdxGGnlT]{邪教徒} 。如果天火教团已经成为敌人，部队的人数将会变为上述的两倍，且卢克雷蒂亚·马西亚斯会召唤 2 位@UUID[Compendium.5e-monster-book.5e-guanmo.Actor.3Y8gJnFBVwQDMPUC]{天神使徒} ，他们会各驻守在一座塔楼上，并警戒着城门。
  • 有时， @UUID[Actor.fKwswI79J2z7lM0i]{那萨利尔·燧石} 会出现在这里，并护送着 [[/r 6d6]] @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.SqZRuJ8lt2KGJBbq]{平民}。

互动

天火信众都很热情，但是会谨慎地对待进入他们营地的客人。狂信者和狂热者会询问任何靠近他们的人想要干什么。如果他们看起来只是出于好奇，或单纯只是路过，他们就会询问这些人是否有意和伯曼·韦伯聊聊，并分给他们一个营火旁的位置让他们为了“漫漫前路”好好休息。

  • 营火旁的每个人都会分享他们是如何加入天火教团的故事，他们对卢克雷蒂亚·马西亚斯的评价很高，且对即将到来的英雄时代充满希冀。他们中的很多人似乎都对朝圣之旅感到兴奋，并会与角色们开诚布公地探讨和辩论天火的内容。
  • 伯曼·韦伯很乐意和角色们交谈，并会恳切地邀请角色们一同追随卢克雷蒂亚·马西亚斯。他会同他们讨论命运以及促成这场相遇的机缘，并以此鼓动角色们去接受圣礼。他相信并会坦率地宣称英雄时代即将来临，而角色们毫无疑问注定将要与他们同行。如果角色拒绝，伯曼则会表示没关系，他会在合适的时候与他们再见。
  • 如果角色做出任何敌对的行为，伯曼和卫兵们会试图保护他们的同伴。教徒们也会进行自卫，但如果战况对他们不利，他们就会逃跑。如果天火信众放弃了这扇城门，他们会在 1d4 天后派更多的人回来夺回它。

学院门

学院门敞开着。门前街道上遍布着废墟，而其中的绝大部分都已经被烧成灰烬。除了建筑物的地基，这里什么也找不到。城门上挂满了发着光的怪异蛛网。蛛网覆盖了整扇城门，使其看起来就像一块布满网状裂纹的碎玻璃。靠近城门时，角色会发现一个诡异的现象。

透过蛛网，人们可以瞥见不同的时间线和现实——他们可能会看到门后人来人往的街道，或者是一座繁荣的宜居城市；也有人会看到可怕的恶魔奴役着人类；还有人看到的是长满真菌和植物、植被肆意蔓生的德拉肯海姆，而其他人看到的则是一片冰冻或燃烧的废土。透过每一块破碎的玻璃，人们都可以看到这座城市所有可能实现的未来和过去。当支离破碎的现实开始扭曲人的心智时，光是看向它就会受到迷惑，致人疯狂。

  • 任何在 60 尺内目睹大门的人都需要通过一次 DC15 的智力豁免，否则则受到 [[/r 2d12]] 点心灵伤害且陷入失能 incapacitated，并立刻投掷一次德拉@UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.tables.RollTable.wS43i9LOvd3Tc4f5]。失能状态会一直持续至有人将他们拉醒或受到任何伤害。
  • 触碰蛛网将会立刻出现 7 （[[/r 2d6]]） @UUID[Compendium.5e-monster-book.5e-guanmo.Actor.qVXeDMB9oEoJTp1y]{相位蜘蛛} ，它们对那些陷入变化莫测幻境中的角色显得格外饥渴。它们会优先攻击处于疯狂状态的角色。
  • 焚毁蛛网是可行的，但蛛网会在 （[[/r 1d6]]） 小时后再次出现。

国王门

十几头@UUID[Compendium.5e-monster-book.5e-guanmo.Actor.GwdxwuNPd7BGW52Q]{巨魔} 盘踞在此大门中。其中三头在门外等着收取通行费，两头在门内操作绞盘，还有两头各在一个塔顶上使用弩炮。除此之外，另有三头在城墙周围进行巡逻。巨魔之王和他忠诚的上尉则处于左塔的第二层，这里被用作巨魔之王新王国的王庭。

  • 巨魔之王扎弗德是一只双头三臂的巨型@UUID[Compendium.5e-monster-book.5e-guanmo.Actor.GwdxwuNPd7BGW52Q]{巨魔} ，他坐在北侧塔楼二层内临时建成的王座上。他的其中一个头叫“扎弗”，另一个头叫“弗德”，他们经常为谁来戴王冠而争论不休。对他来说，进出门是件麻烦事，所以他很少离开房间。他的大肚子垂到膝盖上，还戴着一串人类头骨制成的项链。那些不交通行费的人，或者巨魔觉得有其他问题的人，都会被带到巨魔之王面前，由他来决定他们的命运。而他们的命运几乎总是被“煮在大锅里，给部队加餐”。
  • 扎弗德头戴着的那顶环形王冠其实是个@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.a26LjC4QxP1oorXC]{智力头带} 。
  • 守门的巨魔有一定的智力水平，虽然他们脾气粗暴，但仍不失为一个活泼且愉悦的群体。
  • 守门的三只巨魔会向每个想进城的人收取一笔“巨魔通行费”。价格其实很公道，只需支付一只胳膊和一条腿！巨魔们先是会讨价还价，只要从小队里交出一个人给他们吃掉，其他人就可以通行。它们会恳求小队交出队伍中最大个、最肥美的人。但也可以跟他们讨价还价，他们也比较容易被说服，但如果给他们牲畜或动物，他们就会忿忿不平地回答：“你吃什么你就是什么！你以为我们是动物吗？我们是文明人，所以只吃文明人！”
  • 冒险者角色们的生命值降低至 0，他们就会被巨魔击晕陷入昏迷 unconscious，并被绑好后带到巨魔之王面前，被当做食物献上。
  • 他们在门楼的最底层设有一个临时监狱，里面关押着接下来要被烹饪和食用的囚犯。他们会把角色们一个个带到他们架在猛火上的大锅里，准备烹煮并吃掉他们。
  • 占据大门的巨魔们进出楼道和门需要用挤的才能通过，因此他们在除睡觉外的时候很少使用塔楼的内部空间。

“进入城市最简单的办法就是从城墙上面飞过去。再坏的情况也不会坏到哪里去吧？”

—— 塞巴斯蒂安·克劳

牧者门

覆影明灯控制着牧者门。无论何时，这里总有十二个@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.J8xjoG4Dxb8WkHtV]{老兵} 和三十个@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.J8xjoG4Dxb8WkHtV]{斥候} 把守着。这里的部队在白天由守门队长雅各布·斯洛伐克管理，晚上则是守门队长雷因·海拉什负责（他们都是人类@UUID[Actor.02VvEfOHseDs38Jm]{城市游侠}） ）。

整个部队成员按十二小时轮班制进行轮换，从而让士兵可以在污霭外进行休息。守门部队在每天早上 8 点和晚上 8 点时进行换班。他们在附近有一个棚屋，里面饲养着六匹强健的@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.actors.Actor.phbmobWarhorse00]{战马} 。看守城门是一项艰巨的任务，因此后备部队也经常被召来轮班，以便让主要的守门将士有更多时间来休息和恢复。

  • 防御工事： 游侠们在门楼周围设置了额外的防御设施。他们在城墙和塔垛上筑起了木围墙，并在城墙下挖出壕沟，壕沟里插满木桩。最后，还在道路上竖起了用沙袋加固的木制路障。在每个塔楼顶上还部署了几个射石器。

互动

这里随时都有信差和马匹准备出发，同样准备好的还有信号枪和号角。

  • 他们会护送冒险者前往城市守卫兵营，那里距离城门只有几百尺远。
  • 有 10%的几率，艾利亚斯·德雷克希尔会在角色们经过这里时出现在这里。
  • 如果覆影明灯已经与玩家角色们或其他势力处于敌对状态中，这里的守备兵力将会翻倍。

圣殿门

圣殿门被@UUID[Actor.clmRXQkHQKqlO3R0]{加米尔}犬怪所占据，他们在大门周围建起了一个简易的棚户营地。在任何时候这里都有近百名加米尔犬怪住在这里，他们的军队就好像一个马蜂窝一样。

  • 70 只 （[[/r 20d6]]） @UUID[Actor.clmRXQkHQKqlO3R0]{加米尔} 和 14 只 （[[/r 4d6]]） @UUID[Compendium.5e-monster-book.5e-guanmo.Actor.u5eV0LxBHads5QNK]{座狼}居住于此。
  • 10 （[[/r 3d6]]） 只 @UUID[Compendium.5e-monster-book.5e-guanmo.Actor.pVizARtQTDxyOzuv]{狂战士} and 5 （[[/r 2d4]]） 只 @UUID[Compendium.5e-monster-book.5e-guanmo.Actor.W2i1IgQJi9T1FVFN]{地狱犬}
    • \

The Crater.name: 陨石坑
The Crater.text:
陨石坑

“从来没有人能去那儿之后回来。我们真的不知道自己在面对什么，不是吗？”

— 佩特拉·朗中尉

陨星坠落于德拉肯海姆的南部。这里曾经是城市的工业中心，现在除了炸毁后残留的废墟和一个雾气弥漫的巨大陨石坑之外，这里什么也没剩下。因为那里存在大量的妄质矿藏，陨石坑的边缘是探矿者和朝圣者之流长期以来都在寻找的目的地。但是很少有人会继续冒险深入其中。妄质之心被深深笼罩在德拉肯海姆最危险、污染最严重的地区之内，疯狂在此肆虐，毁灭在此悸动。

总览

根据目标的不同，计划前往陨石坑的角色可能只打算到达陨石坑的边缘，也可能会穿过陨石坑盆地抵达陨石坑的中心。无论如何，他们都需要强有力的工具来保护自己免受污染。

冒险引子

勘测撞击点。 （紫晶学院，白银骑士团或覆影明灯）。 如果角色们发现了一种极其有效的可以抵御污染的方法，例如@UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.spells.Item.NeuT000000000006] 法术或者 @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.items.Item.HazT000000000008]， 那么派系领袖就可能会向角色们发出任务，让他们通过这些手段前往陨石坑。任务目标很简单：找出里面有什么。派系领袖会提出以下警告：

  • 法师们曾试图通过使用 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.fVbCxFRaORalHB20]{探知}和神术魔法对陨石坑进行研究，但在这个过程中都发疯了。那些尝试传送进入内部的施法者则再也没回来过。
  • 魔能闪电环绕在陨石坑上方，被它劈中的生物会直接被解离。
  • @UUID[Actor.tqJK1mzxPst0xV08] 曾只身前往过那里，但她对自己在那的所见所闻闭口不谈。她隐晦地表示那里的东西无法被解释或理解，必须自己亲眼见证。

天火朝圣者 Pilgrimage of Falling Fire。 （天火信众） 对卢克雷蒂亚·马西亚斯的教义深信不疑的角色将受邀前往陨石坑边缘朝圣。在那里，每个人都必须找到匹配自己灵魂形状的妄质晶片，然后把它带回圣格蕾莎礼拜堂，也就是朝圣者参加天火圣礼 的地方。

互动

“在你的腹中燃起一团火，温暖你的心，为自己的前路照亮一盏明灯。”

卢克雷蒂亚·马西亚斯、 @UUID[Actor.fKwswI79J2z7lM0i]， 以及其他天火信众经常带领 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.qkLNA1lKMMJpxuWg]{邪教徒} 和 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.SqZRuJ8lt2KGJBbq]{平民} 前往陨石坑边缘，在这个地区可以经常遇到他们。在该区域内的任何随机遭遇都有可能被替换为一支天火突击队，或由一名 @UUID[Actor.JLIamINrQLGlBiPn] 领导的由 10 （[[/r 3d6]]） 名 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.qkLNA1lKMMJpxuWg]{邪教徒} 组成的朝圣队伍。

天火朝圣者

只有足够虔诚地追随天火信众的角色才会被邀请去陨石坑边缘完成朝圣之旅，在那里他们将在圣格蕾莎礼拜堂接受一场名为天火圣礼的仪式。角色可以独自接受圣礼或者作为其他天火朝圣者队伍的一员参加仪式。虽然外人很少能目睹仪式流程，但天火信众也会容许一名礼貌的旁观者，并希望亲眼见证仪式能打消他们心中残存的疑虑。

灵魂形状的晶片

当他们来到陨石坑边缘时，朝圣者必须独自搜寻一块能够反应自己内心的样貌的妄质晶片。每次尝试寻找都要花费 1 小时，然后角色使用自己最高的属性值进行一次属性检定。当检定结果在 20 或以上时，他们就能找到一块合适的晶片，并且应当描述和扮演角色们是如何被这个检定引导找到这块妄质晶片的。绝大多数的普通朝圣者都必须造访陨石坑边缘数次才能找到一块符合条件的晶片。

完成朝圣

当朝圣者找到了晶片之后，他们就必须把它带到圣格蕾莎礼拜堂（见下文），在那里他们会接受 @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.spells.Item.q1NhS5cx7cp2vBMl] （新法术详见 附录 D）。

区域详述

整个南部城区都处于浓厚污霭中 （见第五章）。

南部废墟

德拉肯海姆南部几乎没有幸存的建筑。除了被毁坏的地基、大块被炸碎的岩石以及成堆的瓦砾和碎石外，几乎没有留下任何东西。浓沉的污霭笼罩在这块废土之上。然而，这股毁灭力量的来源方向是比较明确的。所有面向陨石坑方向的墙壁或柱子上的石头、砖块和木头都被融化而非被烧毁，而在某些地方，石头或木头的碎片甚至被烧成了玻璃。偶尔，你们会看见地面上或倾倒的建筑墙壁上被融化的妄质发出的微光。这里的空气寒冷刺骨，迷雾在四处盘旋飘荡如同在催眠一般。空气中萦绕着一股辛辣刺鼻的奇特气味，仿佛附近有某种奇怪的东西正在燃烧。偶尔你们会听到岩石崩塌的声响，亦或者是远处的建筑物轰然倒塌的声音。

  • 当角色们正在穿越这个地区时，正常进行随机遭遇检定。

陨石坑边缘

你们站在陨石坑的边缘上。在这里，在一处迷雾笼罩的盆地边缘，岩石悬崖上矗立着一座被炸毁的城市的废墟。一缕浓雾从陨石坑的中心升起。诡异的光束伴随着爆裂声在空中划过一道道弧线直冲云霄，与此同时，一道凌冽的寒风呼啸而过。卡在深坑表面的无数妄质碎片正在闪闪发光。

  • 从悬崖的边缘向陨石坑盆地底部一路延伸，有着 150 尺长的陡坡。
  • 由于浓厚的迷雾，想从这里直接看见陨石坑内的地表情况是不可能的。
  • DC 15 奥秘。 对浓雾进行研究并成功通过检定的角色会意识到这里的污霭尤其浓厚，而且很可能比普通的污霭具有更加严重的污染。你可以告诉角色们，在盆地内，很可能每 10 分钟就要进行一次进行对抗污染的体质豁免。
  • DC 15 自然或求生。 仔细观察陨石坑中央盘旋的迷雾，就可以发现有高能闪电在烟雾中划过数道轨迹。你可以将陨石坑盆地内的魔能闪电的详情告知角色们（见下文）。

攀爬悬崖

爬上或爬下悬崖需要成功通过三个 DC 15 的力量 （运动） 检查。角色可以使用装备或法术帮助攀爬——例如 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.pub0OWVEB71XQx1n]{羽落术} 或 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.KJRVzeMQXPj8Gtyx]{蛛行术} 之类的法术可以直接自动成功。

  • 单个检定失败的角色会从尖锐的岩壁上摔落，并受到 10 （[[/r 3d6]]） 点钝击伤害 。
  • 在达成三次检定成功之前已经检定失败满三次的角色会摔得很惨。他会受到 17 （[[/r 5d6]]） 点钝击伤害和 （[[/r 5d6]]） 点穿刺伤害。

此外，角色们还可以搜索废墟（见第五章），并找到一处较为平缓的斜坡或可以轻松下坡的道路。

如果你想在这时增添一些紧张感，可以考虑让一只 @UUID[Actor.nqdTPETJHquUMVIW] 爬出陨石坑，并在角色们眺望盆地、攀爬悬崖或寻找下坡道路时袭击他们！

圣格蕾莎礼拜堂

沿着陨石坑的西北部而行，圣格蕾莎礼拜堂坐落于此。这座教堂的圆顶早已荡然无存。取而代之的是漂浮在空中的这座圆形礼拜堂的砖块，它们都被拆解成了规则的几何形状。也许如果能解除那个导致它们高悬于半空的魔法，它们就能坍塌回原本的位置。在礼拜堂的外墙之内，在层层叠叠的大理石台阶上摆放着一个点燃着的石制火祭盆。 @UUID[Actor.DNEEnuRXXzpD769i] 在发出非自然的紫红色光芒熊熊燃烧着，里面所使用的煤炭全是妄质的碎片。地板上的马赛克已经破裂。还有几个曾经可能摆放过雕像的平台，然而现在除了被炸碎的石头外，什么也没剩。

  • 每天的黎明时分都可以在这里遇到正在给至多 12 名朝圣者举行@UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.spells.Item.q1NhS5cx7cp2vBMl] 的 @UUID[Actor.tqJK1mzxPst0xV08]。@UUID[Actor.fKwswI79J2z7lM0i] 有时也会在这里引导朝圣者
  • 圣者格蕾莎 Saint Gresha （见下文）会在每日黄昏于此举行仪式。
  • 12 个中立善良的 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.rbyp54px2D0ql4QK]{尸妖} 会守卫着礼拜堂。它们都穿戴着古旧的半身板甲。它们是安葬于礼拜堂内的前圣武士的神圣遗骸，并且都不是 @UUID[Actor.2z1ZlGCaN2U8uZeP]。

“我曾经做过一些可怕的噩梦。但这个地方比它们还要恐怖。”

— 塞巴斯蒂安·克劳

圣者格蕾莎

格蕾莎是一名中立善良的@UUID[Actor.lAt2j5PaTnH71T5O]。她被卢克雷蒂亚·马西亚斯以灵魂的形态唤回现世，照看这座与她同名的礼拜堂。她的施法特性替换为以下特性：

  • 随意： @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplLight00000]{光亮术}， @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGuidance00]{神导术}，@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplSacredFlam]{圣火术}，@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplThaumaturg]{奇术}
  • 3/每日： @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplBless00000]{祝福术}，@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFlameStrik]{焰击术}，@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGuidingBol]{光导箭}，@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHealingWor]{治愈真言}，@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplPrayerofHe]{治疗祷言}，@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.uCud2s4TjMfjiXUb]{灵体卫士}
  • 1/每日： @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDivineWord]{圣言术}，@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHarm000000]{重伤术}，@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMassHeal00]{群体医疗术}，@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHolyAura00]{圣洁灵光}，@UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.spells.Item.q1NhS5cx7cp2vBMl]{天火圣礼}

如果圣者格蕾莎被摧毁，卢克雷蒂亚·马西亚斯就会尽快地重新召回她的灵魂。

陨石坑盆地

陨石坑盆地一片荒凉。裸露的地表呈现出深紫褐色。脚下则布满了黑色的玻璃碎片和岩石砂砾，其中还夹杂着一些难以辨认来源的砖石建筑的碎屑和妄质颗粒。奇特的植物在这里肆意生长：爬满地面的苔藓像是裸露的筋腱或肿胀的器官组织，叶片像是肉膜，而植物的根像是蔓延的血管。这些奇怪的植物紧紧依附在一簇簇的妄质和污泥池周围。

浓厚污霭： 在陨石坑内，浓厚污霭尤其浓密，甚至几乎遮蔽住了视线：30 尺外的视野将被完全遮蔽，同时绝大部分来自天上的光照也被阻隔开，因此这个区域内光线昏暗，视野模糊不清。每在里面逗留 10 分钟，角色就必须通过一个 DC 20 的体质豁免，否则将受到 10 （[[/r 3d6]]） 点暗蚀伤害并获得 1 级污染。

魔能闪电： 一片片闪烁发光着的能量和噼啪作响的魔能闪电穿透了陨石坑周围的迷雾，直直穿透上空的云层。任何在陨石坑盆地的上空飞行高度超过 60 尺的空中生物在每个回合结束时投掷 1d6：出目为 1 时，该生物就会被闪电击中，他必须通过一个 DC20 的敏捷豁免，否则就会受到 10d6 点闪电伤害和 10d6 点力场伤害。如果这些伤害导致该生物的生命值降至 0，则他和他身上携带的一切物品都会化为黑灰，然后随风而逝。该生物只有通过完全 @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplResurrecti]{复生术} 或 @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplWish000000]{祈愿术} 才能复活。

扭曲的空间： 传送进入或离开陨石坑盆地的生物会被魔能力量撕裂，并会如同被魔能闪电击中一般受到伤害（见上文）。

寻找妄质之心

寻找妄质之心的角色必须花费 1 小时搜索废墟，就和第五章中“探索德拉肯海姆”的规则一致。除了需要进行调查检定，角色还可以使用奥秘、洞悉、宗教、自然和求生技能来协助探索盆地。检定成功需要 DC 20 的检定结果，任何出目高于 25 的检定结果都可以额外增加一个成功数量。角色每次尝试搜寻得到的成果取决于他们的成功次数：

2 次成功 或 更少

没有

3 次成功

巨型妄质晶簇团

4 次成功或以上

妄质之心

两个或更多的检定失败会随机触发以下的一项随机遭遇。由于角色们正暴露在效果更强烈的浓厚污霭中，因此他们需要某种方法来获得对污染的免疫，否则每次尝试探索陨石坑时，他们都必须进行 6 次体质豁免。

陨石坑盆地的随机遭遇

在角色们探索盆地时同以往的探索流程一样进行随机遭遇检定，使用以下表格生成遭遇。

巨型妄质晶簇团

巨大无比的妄质晶簇团从陨石坑盆地的地底破土伸出。它们大多有一人高，有些则和食人魔一样大，或者甚至更大。黏稠的乳白色液体从晶体内流出，在周围形成了一个污泥池。

  • 在晶簇团和污泥池边上徘徊着一个 活体浓厚污霭 ， @UUID[Actor.JU5DYHnBwwFj4jC3]， 自走妄质晶簇 ， 和一个 @UUID[Actor.DNEEnuRXXzpD769i]
  • 污泥池深 2 至 3 尺，直径从 10 尺到 40 尺不等。
  • 角色们可以找到 1 块妄质晶簇，[[/r 1d6]] 块妄质水晶和 [[/r 2d6]] 块妄质晶块，这些晶体都很容易获取。但是，使用便携式设备是不可能在野外开采巨大晶体的。
  • I 如果攻击或伤害这些巨型晶簇将会引发一次 @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.tables.RollTable.pPGtKhPFFcHortCT]{奥术异常随机表}。

妄质之心

这里空气潮湿，四处弥漫着刺鼻的臭氧味。噼啪作响的魔能能量让你们汗毛倒竖，令人不适的低沉蜂鸣声在耳畔作响。突然，迷雾散去了一些，露出一块高 70 尺、宽 30 尺的巨大妄质晶体。岩石和陨铁的碎片附着在晶体的侧面，而晶体本身散发出令人目眩的第八虹色光芒，并且肉眼可见的从中流出了色彩斑斓的妄质污泥，并在其周围形成了一个小污泥池。晶体的边缘以一种难以理解的角度相交在一起，尽管从晶体外表面上看起来它是静止不动的，但其几何结构却在不断变化。这让你们光是看向它就感到一阵头疼。向上翻起的土堆、巨大的陨铁块和硕大的妄质晶簇团像是一座岛屿一样从污泥池中浮现出来。

  • 这就是那块陨石核心的全部残骸。仅仅是看到它那难以理解的几何外形就足以致人疯狂。当一个类人生物第一次见到妄质之心时，他必须通过一次 DC 20 的智力豁免。豁免失败时，他就会受到和 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.hYCrN82dMJFuJODB]{弱智术} 效果相同的效应影响。
  • The 妄质污泥池有 4 尺深 （见 附录 D）。
  • 在妄质之心周围 120 尺内结束自己回合的生物必须通过一次 DC 20 的体质豁免，不然就会受到 10（3d6）点暗蚀伤害并获得 1 级污染。豁免失败五次及以上的生物会受到 35 （[[/r 3d6]]） 点暗蚀伤害并获得 （[[/r 1d4]]） 级污染。
  • 宝藏： 可以在这里发现一块 原始妄质晶簇 和 10 （[[/r 3d6]]） 妄质水晶。 这种极其罕见的晶体的结构完全对称且独一无二，任何角色都能在妄质之心周围轻易获取妄质。
  • 角色们必须和来时一样，搜索陨石坑边缘废墟的痕迹，并重新找到从妄质之心处返回的路。
  • 靠近妄质之心周围 10 尺的角色可以仔细地检查它。它是空心的：悬浮在液态水银中的大量胚胎状肉块被纤细的经脉和半透明、不断搏动的心脏状器官相连。触碰妄质之心的生物的眼前则会突然出现一道景象：

这个幻象宛如惊鸿一瞥，却又仿佛持续了数千年的时光。一颗陨星与一个陌生的世界相撞。闪烁着绚烂色彩的迷雾自撞击点所在之处开始缓缓升腾。巨大尖锐的晶体刺破地表迸发而出，人们则陷入了混乱和疯狂。这颗腐败的球体突然又猛地裂开，向宇宙中射出弹幕般的彗星，直到其中一颗彗星掠过你们所在的这个世界。

摧毁妄质之心

角色们可以尝试摧毁妄质之心：

  • 它具有 AC 25 和 500 点生命值。只要它还拥有 1 点生命值，它在每轮的先攻 20 时会回复 50 点生命值。
  • 妄质之心免疫冷冻、闪电、暗蚀、穿刺、毒素、心灵、挥砍以及非魔法的钝击伤害。它对火焰伤害具有抗性。它对雷鸣伤害具有易伤。
  • 一轮一次，在先攻 20 时，如果妄质之心在上一轮受到过伤害，它施放一次 @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.tables.RollTable.pPGtKhPFFcHortCT]{奥术异常}。巨大的响声会在每回合内吸引周遭的生物，吸引来的生物使用上述的随机遭遇表来决定。

当妄质之心被摧毁，它会爆炸并对半径 500 尺范围内的一切生物造成 10d6 点暗蚀伤害，10d6 点光耀伤害，10d6 点心灵伤害，10d6 点穿刺伤害，和 10d6 点雷鸣伤害。这场爆炸会导致其碎裂成 13 块巨型晶簇团，这些晶簇团会猛冲向城市，如果不去摧毁它们，每个晶簇团都会在一年内重新生长成一颗妄质之心。妄质之心内的胚胎状物质会流入污泥中，并迅速生长成一只恐怖的憎恶：一只 @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmTarrasque00000]{泰拉斯奎}。

“感觉不如卡斯匹亚峡谷那般雄伟，但是这里有更多的怪物适合我做运动。”

—— 普鲁托·杰克逊

发展

“这个可怕的消息只是证实了我们早就做过的设想罢了。德拉肯海姆已经不复存在了。”

—— 大法师埃德瑞克·符文织者

那些期待着各派系会因他们的报告而团结起来的归来的角色们将会大失所望。

覆影明灯。 艾利亚斯·德雷克希尔会因角色们的报告而震惊，报告的内容绝望地证实了想要光复德拉肯海姆绝非易事，他会意识到自己需要另一个派系的协助才能完成这一目标。总司令甚至不确定他是否应该向将士们透露这份报告。他是对的。士兵们在得知这个消息时，他们就与白银骑士团、天火信众还是紫晶学院合作的利弊爆发了剧烈的争执。如果角色们已经和这些派系中的任一派系为敌，就会有一些人大声且轻蔑地宣称角色们已经让他们全都要完蛋了。除非角色们和艾利亚斯·德雷克希尔能尽快取得另一场重大胜利，否则这场暴乱就会愈演愈烈，覆影明灯将会解体成为四分五裂的战团。

紫晶学院。 @UUID[Actor.IFRQ1jK41KOQNjGl] 对妄质之心的消息非常有兴趣，并公开表示他们可以从中得到深不可测的奥法力量（从而避免另一个世界的灾难在此重演）。在几天后，他又会找到角色们，并询问他们是否准备再进行一次冒险，以帮助他设置一个由他设计的魔法奥术中继器。如果角色们没有带回原始妄质晶簇，他还会让角色们把它带回来。

天火信众。一旦角色们从陨石坑的中心返回，卢克雷蒂亚·马西亚斯就能解释他们所看到的任何幻象背后的含义。然后，她会揭露天火圣礼的真正目的：她相信只要在妄质中储存足够多的虔诚的灵魂，这种物质就将成为圣火在人间的容器，将来自宇宙的灾祸变为救世主。圣化的妄质将在宇宙间播撒光明。当被问及这个世界的命运时，卢克雷蒂亚·马西亚斯会说，圣火要求凡人为正确的事业做出牺牲。不过她的说法是否属实，就得等到事件发生后才能确定了。

白银骑士团。希奥多·马歇尔认为此刻的情势已经无可争辩：德拉肯海姆必须化为火灰。而且整个世界的命运都取决于此。要达成这一目标并不轻松，但是现在的任务已经很明确：白银骑士团必须复活阿贡纳斯，用他的龙息摧毁妄质之心。

女王的弟兄们。 @UUID[Actor.k1Me7WfCcgKcAFQe] 对这一消息的反应只有放声大笑。如此可怕的威胁竟然就在城市的中心，这对她来说真是天大的好消息。只要它还呆在那，就没有人能真正统治德拉肯海姆——除了她。盗贼女王想要利用这些情报在其他派系中，尤其是在覆影明灯内制造怀疑和分歧。不管怎么说，角色们在幻象中所见的一切都不会那么快就发生。

Kleinberg Estate.name: 克莱恩伯格庄园
Kleinberg Estate.text:
Kleinberg Estate

Deep in the noble district of Drakkenheim, just south of Castle Drakken, a walled off community known as the Kleinberg Estate stands. Amongst the ruins and debris, several of the large mansions have survived the devastation of Drakkenheim. One such estate has become lively with activity in recent years. Figures have been seen coming and going from it, which has spurred whispers and rumours within the taverns of Emberwood village. Conversations between forlorn adventurers and sickly survivors speak of a mage working out of the estate who has means to help those who are suffering with contamination. The validity of these claims is yet to be proven, and so those seeking help best be wary, as more often than not, people who have ventured deeper in search of a cure seldom return.

Overview

There may be many reasons the player characters choose to uncover the Pale Man.

Adventure Hooks

Search for a Cure. Characters seeking the means to reverse a monstrous transformation might seek out the @UUID[Actor.uMQvgbPhxlHLl1vG], as rumours abound of the secretive mage who can help with mutations and contamination.

The Academy Deal. The Academy might hire the party to find the Pale Man and uncover what secret spells and arcane concoctions he has created. @UUID[Actor.1p6ksQrMvxCBPkga] asks the players to retrieve his work and bring it back to them with any relevant information or samples. The Academy is willing to offer the Pale Man a deal for his cooperation, but fully expect him to decline. They do not care if the Pale Man lives, as long as his work is recovered.

The Witch Hunt. The Silver Order might hire the players to find and kill the Pale Man - they want his work burned, and any delerium in his possession destroyed.

Interactions

The minions that work for the Pale Man are more social than normal dregs, and should be portrayed as having quirky, weird, and insane personalities. They direct characters to Raven, who handles all business deals. None of them know much about the Pale Man's research or experiments, and just express relief at the aid he has offered them.

Friedrich von Lichten, the Pale Man

Friedrich Von Lichten ambitiously explored the mutagenic effects of delerium after Drakkenheim's destruction, and was among the first to fully describe the effects of eldritch contamination upon the human body. He was ejected from the Amethyst Academy when it was discovered he was using apprentices as test subjects. So grave was his trespass, that the Academy notified the Silver Order of his existence, putting a death bounty on his head. Both The Silver Order and the Amethyst Academy have been searching for him since.

“There are monsters around every corner of this city, but the real monsters are in our minds. No, really, there are monsters that can crawl inside your head, watch out for those ones.”

— Veo Sjena
  • Personality Trait. Witness my power, understand that I am the future. Some may call me a god, and I would not correct them.
  • Ideal. We must embrace the Haze, and allow contamination to change us, make us better.
  • Bonds. The Amethyst Academy lacks vision. I will show them the true power of delerium.
  • Flaw. It is not enough that I merely outsmart my foes, they must be shown their weakness and failure.

Friedrich von Lichten has fully embraced contamination and transformed into a monster, and is now the Pale Man (see Appendix A for game statistics). He has maintained his intellect, and drapes his hunched and withered figure in a black cloak. Beneath his paper-thin skin are wriggling and writhing things. His lidless eyes are sunken, his teeth are prominent, yellowing and decaying. One can just make out a sickly green tongue that darts out when he speaks. He talks in a stunted, almost exasperated tone.

He presents his estate as a safehouse for the lost and forgotten.

The Pale Man sows the rumours that he can help contaminated people so he can use them as test subjects for his experiments. When he meets a transformed or contaminated creature, he presents himself as a helpful expert, offering to treat any individual left in his care. He never actually cures contamination, but sometimes helps other transformed monsters become somewhat lucid so he can make better use of them as minions. The Pale Man spends most of his time in the repurposed master bedroom of the estate he uses as his laboratory, and gives orders only to his most trusted thralls.

Mutated Thralls

These three @UUID[Actor.sHgFXfdwxl0mefuB]{Haze Hulks} are the most intelligent and loyal of the Pale Man's servants. They came to him willingly and embraced his alterations. The Pale Man allowed them to keep their lives and minds, and in exchange they serve him.

Raven a @UUID[Actor.sHgFXfdwxl0mefuB]{Gutbuster Haze Hulk} is a portly woman with blue skin, white glowing eyes, and thick stringy black hair wearing a burlap cloak with a hood. She is extremely cautious of visitors, but is often the first to greet and question people coming to the estate.

Henry. Henry, a @UUID[Actor.QLve30GX7Zb3nN7a]{Hunter Haze Hulk} is the most intelligent of the three. He wears black scraps of leather and has a long sallow face and large black eyes.

Grunt. Grunt, a @UUID[Actor.H4eFETYZ4F5mDIwr]{Juggernaut Haze Hulk}, is the biggest of the three, with beady eyes on his tiny bald head and a massive hulking body. He is usually found in the estate house or the stables working as the personal guard for the Pale Man.

Lisa. Lisa is the Pale Man's favourite creation, transformed by contamination into a @UUID[Actor.nqdTPETJHquUMVIW]. He used her as the conduit for many of his early attempts to @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.spells.Item.SipT000000000011], transforming her into the monster she now is.

Area Details

Estate Grounds

A grand mansion stands atop a rolling hill in the middle of this expansive walled estate. The steep terracotta roofs and grey stone walls are wracked with decay now. The windows are shattered and boarded over, the white-paint trim chipping away. Downhill from the main house is a large stable. Entering the grounds from the main gate, characters can see a stubby fieldstone tower with a small cottage abutting it, but the upper levels of the tower have collapsed. A small guardpost sits beside the creaking wrought-iron gates hanging from the fieldstone walls that surround the estate. Several dying trees dot the lawns, and a brackish pond rests west of the manor house. Several hooded figures wander the property. Some are watering flowers, others lounging about the grounds, while one is throwing rocks in the pond.

  • The property walls are ten feet tall and crested with spikes.
  • Almost all the windows are boarded up. Aside from a small window on the stables, each is purposely blocked from prying eyes.
  • 10 ([[/r 3d6]]) other @UUID[Actor.WRMeQqdgYSpAR9zx]{Delerium Dregs} are scattered around the courtyard tending to menial tasks or entertaining themselves.
  • Guard House. A small stone guard house sits next to the front gate. A small cloaked creature with a big toothy grin sits mumbling to himself and playing a game of cards alone.
  • This @UUID[Actor.WRMeQqdgYSpAR9zx] greets any who approach, asking their business. If characters seem peaceful, it will direct them to see Raven at the stables.

Tower House

Sickly moss and blighted ivy creep up from the ground and wrap around this tower. There is a small red-roofed cabin off the base, but the upper level of the tower has crumbled away.

Servant's Quarters. There are several little creatures working here, they all seem to be reading through notes and relaxing at a small table. The rooms are filled with cots and bunk beds for the various dregs that inhabit the grounds to sleep and rest. There are only a few rooms so they are jammed with various sleeping surfaces. Everything from beds crudely piled on top of one another, or drawers pulled out and stuffed with hay and pillows. The dregs seemed pleased to sleep just about anywhere and the rooms show a disorganized cluttered mess of their living arrangements.

  • 5 @UUID[Actor.WRMeQqdgYSpAR9zx]{Delerium Dregs} are lounging in this room
  • Henry is keeping watch of the minions.
  • Scrawled on the wall here are several bits of graffiti that seem to be directed at the servants that used to live here. Most notably are the words “Don't forget your candle.”

Collapsed tower. The walls are mostly intact on this second level, but the ceiling is long gone and the upper floor is covered in debris. A few empty cages are placed here.

  • Dregs use these cages as holding for misbehaving companions.

Stables. Any sign that these stables were once used to house horses is gone, the inside stripped away and made into a makeshift workstation. The stables act as both a storage compartment for finished products of delerium dust, but also housing for the many dregs who reside in the estate. Several of the stalls are lined with hay, dirty blankets, and buckets. The front of the stables by the entrance have been made into a sort of shop where Raven sits at a small table with various potions and alchemical ingredients lined for display.

  • 30 @UUID[Actor.WRMeQqdgYSpAR9zx]{Delerium Dregs} are found here either sleeping, performing menial tasks, or polishing the black coach.
  • Raven often oversees products, shipping and sales that all happen out of the stable.
  • Grunt sits telling stories to several of the delerium dregs resting here.
  • Secret Entrance. At the back of the stable is an old hatch that opens to a ladder down to the old tunnels below the manor.

Black Coach. Parked in the stable is a beautiful and well-kept black coach with red curtained windows.

  • On rare occasions when the Pale Man travels the streets, he has his haze hulks pull him in this coach. He insists it be polished and cleaned daily.

Mansion Ground Level

The mansion is a large two-storey property with east and west wings on either side of an entrance foyer accessed by two decorated double doors. Above the doors is a round stained glass window featuring a patterned radial design.

  • All windows are boarded up except for one on the front right that looks into one of the wretched drawing rooms.

Foyer. Entering the house by the front door you come into an open room. A huge golden chandelier holds one hundred candles that flicker light and shadows around the foyer. Straight ahead a large staircase heads up to a second floor balcony overlooking the foyer. A huge circular stained glass window fills the room with coloured light. To the left and right are doors that lead to either of the wings, while flanking the grand staircase are two statues of majestic horses carved out of marble. The walls are lined with brilliant artwork depicting sunsets on fields, galloping wild horses, a snow covered valley with a small cottage and other beautiful scenic pictures that almost always include horses.

  • Trapped Door. The east door on the upper level is a heavy wooden door depicting a carving of winged beings soaring up towards the top of the door, and grotesque emaciated-looking creatures below reaching up to try and grab the fleeing angels. The door is @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.8cse7rit0oswRPUP]{Arcane Locked} and only the password “As Above, So Below” will allow one to access the door. The Pale Man uses this door to access the balcony over the foyer to give orders to his minions

Wretched Drawing Rooms. These once well-appointed drawing rooms are now covered in cobwebs and broken furniture, dismantled bookshelves, and dirty animal fur rugs. The rooms have been stripped of any valuables or usable goods.

  • There are 5 ([[/r 2d4]]) @UUID[Actor.WRMeQqdgYSpAR9zx]{Delerium Dregs} in each of these rooms.

Decrepit Dining Room. Food and dirt cover the various walls and surfaces. Paintings are hanging crooked, while some have been broken. There is a long wooden feasting table with four chairs on either side and a grand throne-like seat at the far end. Faces are drawn over hanging portraits and crude words are scrawled across the wall in food substances or possibly blood.

  • There are 8 @UUID[Actor.WRMeQqdgYSpAR9zx]{Delerium Dregs} eating. They know very well that this section of the manor is off limits to guests.
  • The food looks relatively unappetizing, a grey sludge with bits of what might be meat, but the creatures here seem keen to enjoy it.

Kitchen. The kitchen is a mess with dirty pots and pans stacked almost to the ceiling. There are knives stuck in the walls, food and slop everywhere, and stains on nearly every surface. Two creatures in little makeshift chefs hats and aprons work diligently to make some sort of bland soup for the residents of the house, occasionally throwing in scraps they find on the floor into a big boiling pot.

  • 2 @UUID[Actor.WRMeQqdgYSpAR9zx]{Delerium Dregs} are here and will attack anyone who interrupts them.

Lounge. A couple couches and armchairs are pushed around an old fireplace. The fireplace is not lit, and has five candelabras set on its mantle with four candles placed in all but one. The furniture has been placed for convenience and conversation and less a proper attempt at outfitting a room.

  • There are 5 ([[/r 2d4]]) @UUID[Actor.WRMeQqdgYSpAR9zx]{Delerium Dregs} here.
  • Secret Entrance. There is a hatch on the ground in the corner that opens to an old stone staircase that goes down into the lower tunnels.
  • Secret Door. If a candle is placed in the empty candelabra on the fireplace mantle it opens the back of the fireplace into a small staircase that goes up to the second level.

Mansion Upper Level

Abandoned Bedchambers. These once sumptuous bedchambers are now disheveled and foetid dens. Clothing has been pulled out of the wardrobes to make disgusting nests upon the shredded and broken beds.

  • 2 ([[/r 1d4]]) @UUID[Actor.WRMeQqdgYSpAR9zx]{Delerium Dregs} inhabit each bedchamber. Some dress up in the fine clothing that remains, or play with the childrens toys abandoned within.

Lab. These adjacent rooms have been stripped of their previous furniture and refashioned into laboratories. There are various forms of equipment here. A table in the back has a strange hammer crafted from delerium and a crate of shards and crystals that are seemingly being smashed into dust. There are alchemical supplies and filtering devices that are used to refine the dust at another station. A third station has herbs and chemical formulas and measuring equipment for concocting arcane delerium dust as well as various delerium infused potions. It looks as though another station is for procuring delerium ink for spell scrolls and other uses.

  • 10 ([[/r 3d6]]) assorted@UUID[Actor.WRMeQqdgYSpAR9zx]{Delerium Dregs} work around the clock in this chamber at the various tables. Some have goggles or other scraps of lab gear.
  • Explosion. If combat occurs, one of the dregs hurls a half finished delerium concoction at the players, which functions as a @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.items.Item.BotT000000000002]

Master Bedroom. Lined with shelves of books, scrolls, folders, documents, and scattered parchments, this room appears to function as a library as well. Several shelves house glass jars with floating objects inside - a jar of eyeballs, a severed hand, an entire human head with one side of it dissolved and melted, several fleshy tentacles, and many other horrors. An old dust-covered bed in the corner appears unused. The desk is covered in various jars of octarine substances as well as an old book bound in red leather and a quill and inkwell of glowing octarine ink.

  • Secret entrance. The bookshelf on the back wall next to the bed has a large blue book titled “the Secret Stairs” - when pulled, it opens to the staircase leading down to the lounge.
  • Amongst the shelves one can find [[/r 1d4]] magical potions, half of which are healing potions, and [[/r 1d6]] uncommon spell scrolls.
  • The spell book on the desk contains the Pale Man's work on the new spells he has created. It is also infused with a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.pB7XVYwdGNcUG935] to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.A4RsPuSvB9wFtz1j] when triggered. The Pale Man will grab his book and flee to his nest if need be.

Study. As you step inside you see a mess of paperwork, tables, and several drawings stuck on the wall with red string connecting various sketches to locations in Drakkenheim. A large red circle on a map of the city indicates a focus on the Inscrutable Tower.

  • The Pale Man has put together a rough plan to seize the Inscrutable Tower for himself. The plans seem incomplete and so far most of his research involves how to get into the tower. He has two current ideas; the first note states the front door will only open for a living Academy member wearing academy rings, the second is research for creating flying minions to fly into the breach. Beyond this, he has not developed the means to control the Nexus.

Underground Lair

Heading into the basement reveals a damp and dank cave. There is a thick moisture in the air and an acrid smell mixed with the scent of hot garbage. It's hard to pinpoint where the smells are coming from but it's unpleasant to say the least. There are a few torches along the cavern edge that seem to light the path ahead.

  • The lair is accessed from either the stables or the manor lounge. Originally it was a passage to get to the stables and feed the horses during heavy winters without having to go outside.
  • Since the Pale Man has moved in, he has expanded the caves below to suit his needs.
  • The entire underground section is protected by the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.yw0tYQkOMCgKZ8Ur] spell. The minions of the house are immune to its effects but any guests or intruders are not.
  • Once entered, the doors to this area vanish into the cave wall. They are still there and it is merely an illusion caused by the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.yw0tYQkOMCgKZ8Ur] spell.

Collapsed Cavern. It seems that an early attempt to expand the tunnels failed. There is a dreg crushed under a pile of rubble here, and there is no way past the rubble.

  • The crushed dreg is clutching a candle and a vial of @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.items.Item.AquT000000000000].

Holding Cells. This area contains a barred jail with a small locked door. The walls and floor are caked with refuse and debris. The cell is filled with wriggling piles of flesh. The flesh has various eyes and mouths and occasional limbs or extremities protruding from them. As you approach the cell, the fleshy mounds begin to quiver and a chorus of sorrowful moans echo through the chamber.

  • Two dregs wander the tunnels down here and their job consists of feeding the “unfortunates” as they call them, and occasionally taking one out of the pen to feed Lisa.
  • If either of the two dregs feel threatened or feel the need to aid in an attack, they will run to pull a lever on the wall that opens the pen, allowing the “unfortunates” to wriggle out and consume anything in their path
  • There are 10 @UUID[Actor.gwrdsxHSdMxcmK79]{Gibbering Mouthers} that can be released from the pen.

Trapped Room. A wrong turn due to the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.yw0tYQkOMCgKZ8Ur] spell, or a misguided search of the corridors and hallways might land you in this room. Once entered, a wooden gate slams over the entrance and the room releases a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.LkvI11Uue774QBKZ] effect.

Lisa's Den. This small alcove is covered in various bones, skeletons, bits of old meat and blood soaked scraps of clothing.

  • Lisa resides here. Unless she hears commotion elsewhere in the tunnels or is retrieved by one of the dregs, she stays here eating.

The Nest. A cave-in at the entrance makes this room very hard to get to. However, this room is the most important room for the Pale Man. Covered floor to ceiling with dripping and oozing delerium sludge and caked with thousands of insectoid looking eggs, this room seems to resemble a sort of nest. Hanging from the ceiling is a large fleshy cocoon-like sack, pulsing gently with a sort of heartbeat.

  • If the Pale Man is reduced to 0 hit points he returns to this nest to recuperate.
  • Destroying the nest means the Pale Man is unable to regenerate and can be killed easily.
  • The cocoon has 100hp and an AC of 12. It is vulnerable to fire, but immune to poison, necrotic, and psychic damage.
  • The entire room is covered in delerium sludge.

Developments

If the Pale Man is destroyed, his minions become confused and terrified. They flee into the city, and slowly revert back into mindless monsters.

Pale Man's Research

The following information can be gathered by either speaking with the Pale Man or studying his writing:

  • Monstrous Transformations. Sufficient eldritch contamination blossoms into a wondrous and self-sustaining mutagenic transformation, after which it cannot simply be purged away. Reversing this is no simple matter. Of course, since the Great Spell may grant any mortal wish, it could be used to restore the previous form of a transformed creature. However, the Academy Directorate jealously guards knowledge of this spell, and I am sure the Archmages would not cast this spell for anyone but themselves. Nevertheless, I believe it may be possible to draw the contaminants out of one body and into that of another.

  • Contaminated Spells. The Pale Man knows the following spells, which are also contained in his spellbooks: delirium orb, @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.spells.Item.DelT000000000003], @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.spells.Item.ForT000000000005], @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.spells.Item.ConT000000000000], @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.spells.Item.PurT000000000008], @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.spells.Item.RayT000000000010], and @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.spells.Item.WarT000000000012].

The Pale Man's research provides critical clues needed for characters to cure a monstrous transformation. Not only does it reveal that the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3okM6Gn63zzEULkz] spell can accomplish this task, it also suggests researching the @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.spells.Item.SipT000000000011] spell (see Appendix D), which can be accomplished by a character who knows the @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.spells.Item.ForT000000000005] and @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.spells.Item.PurT000000000008] spells.

Plight of the Pale Man

In the event that the Pale Man survives and retreats to his nest to regenerate, the characters may think they have defeated him. The Pale man will plot his revenge and eventually attempt to take the Inscrutable Tower for himself.

The Academy is happy if the Pale Man is killed and his work retrieved. If the Pale Man survives, the Academy expresses the urgency that control of the tower needs to be obtained as soon as possible. The Silver Order is satisfied if the Pale Man was killed or brought in and his estate and research destroyed.

Old Town Cistern.name: 旧城蓄水池
Old Town Cistern.text:
Old Town Cistern

Beneath Slaughterstone Square is a large underground reservoir filled with the waterlogged corpses of the @UUID[Actor.4UrBZVZ2pkfwy8h3]'s many victims. As a result, the macabre chamber has become the favoured scavenging ground for a group of @UUID[Actor.987Wm71wEZ5XyT1i]{Aquatic Delerium Dregs} who serve an eldritch creature known as the Duchess. This nightmarish entity lurks deep below Drakkenheim's forsaken waterways, slowly amassing contaminated thralls while fostering dark dreams to usurp control of the surface.

Overview

Your characters might simply stumble into the cistern while exploring the sewers, or by taking the smugglers' passage from the Black Ivory Inn. The cistern lies directly below Slaughterstone Square, so characters may even seek refuge here from the Executioner. You should review that location before reading this section further.

Adventure Hooks

An Invitation from the Duchess. While exploring the river, sewers, or another aquatic location, the characters encounter a curious group of 12 @UUID[Actor.987Wm71wEZ5XyT1i]{Aquatic Delerium Dregs} and 2 @UUID[Actor.x9AHZBzL0qfZXxBa]{Chuuls} who are not outwardly hostile. Two step forward peacefully with trepidation, introducing themselves as Blip-Bloop and Slurpy. They implore characters to help them find a suitable gift to bring back to their mistress, who they refer to as the “Duchess”. If questioned, they can convey the following information:

  • “Our Duchess will show you great hospitality, I'm sure of it! If you would bring her a gift or perform a service for her, she could reward you greatly, I'm sure of it! What is it you desire? Knowledge! Magic! Health! Our Duchess is as mighty as she is benevolent, I'm sure of it!”

  • “She would love a magic trinket, or perhaps a great crystal, of course! I'm sure of it!”

  • “The Duchess is ruler of the deep water, all that flows below is her domain! I'm sure of it! She shelters and protects us, and in turn we are her loyal retainers, I'm sure of it!

  • “She dwells near a great pool that collects the sky-water. There is a terrible machine upon the surface, but we know a hidden way there by water! I'm sure of it!”

If the characters refuse at this first meeting, or attack, it's possible they could encounter this group again (or similar ones) during their future adventures in the city. Don't force this hook upon the player characters: this is something they should investigate on their own initiative!

Alternate Hooks

It's easy to miss this adventure site, but since it contains an important Seal of Drakkenheim, you may need to troubleshoot. If your players don't take the bait, consider the following:

  • One of the faction leaders asks characters to investigate the following rumour: “The bodies of many slain adventurers and faction agents are said to rest in the cistern beneath Slaughtstone Square. Who knows how many magic items are lost there?”
  • An encounter with aquatic dregs leaves behind a clue related to a character's personal quest, indicating the aquatic dregs possess a lost magic item or missing person (who is now transformed into one of the aquatic dregs or even the @UUID[Actor.TkaVIsqv9qlYuRJk]{Duchess' attendants}).

Interactions

The Duchess is an otherworldly abomination who holds many mutated @UUID[Actor.987Wm71wEZ5XyT1i]{aquatic delerium dregs} in thrall, using them to gather delerium and lure unsuspecting explorers to its lair to contaminate.

The Duchess

The Duchess is an @UUID[Actor.msq8zmGvxl9Oi5gv] of unfathomable origin. Whether it was brought here by the unstable rifts of the Haze, or the result of some mutated origin, none can say. It uses its knowledge, telepathy, and mind-reading abilities to make deceptive offers that appeal to characters' deepest desires, manipulating them into embracing contamination so they will become its thralls.

  • Personality Trait. I rule my subjects like a benevolent matron, and eagerly invite guests to my household so they can serve my will forever.
  • Ideal. The destiny of the Haze cannot be stopped, all will become contaminated and corrupt, all will bask within the eldritch embrace of distant stars.
  • Bond. I have heard the clarion call of the @UUID[Actor.FaQBcQeboMfO6hOL] in Castle Drakken. Soon it will open a dimensional rift. I must seek servants and magic so I may seize it for myself.
  • Flaw. I grow angry and impatient when mortals do not regard me with fear and veneration.

The Duchess is deeply in tune with the magic of the Haze. Though it does not know the origins of the meteor, the Duchess is aware that the Haze will eventually overtake the world and can sense the dimensional rift within Castle Drakken (see chapter 9). It is amassing delerium, magic items, and contaminated thralls with the hopes of one day seizing the rift and ruling the surface. It dimly understands the Seals of Drakkenheim may be useful in this regard, and so wants to acquire those items as well.

Duchess' Attendants

These three wretches are the favoured thralls of the Duchess. Called the Cardinal, the Chamberlain, and the Chancellor, each is a former human transformed by contamination. They use the game statistics for a @UUID[Actor.7WaDpAKH4yXQeYJk] with their creature type changed to aberration. The attendants use their powers to appear as humans garbed in flowing blue robes to lure and deceive visitors, but their mutations are more horrific than the aquatic delerium dregs, whom they regard as their subservient kin. Their original memories and personalities have been nearly obliterated by madness, and they now loyally serve the Duchess' strange agenda. They tend the Monument of the Duchess in the Bathhouse Ruins. The Chancellor is in truth the transformed Royal Chancellor of Drakkenheim, Balrin Barthes, and still wears the @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.items.Item.ChaT000000000016].

  • Personality Trait. We are the attendants of the Duchess. Come see our customs and partake of our strange ways, and all will be revealed. The water holds great secrets; drink deeply of its knowledge.
  • Ideal. Our blessed offerings help the Duchess in her quest to open the way and the gate.
  • Bond. We escaped the castle but did not make it further. The Duchess has rescued us.
  • Flaw. We do not remember who we once were, but the Duchess tells us we must make preparations to one day rise from the waters to walk upon the surface once more.

Area Details

The water in these areas is contaminated. Characters who end their turn swimming or submerged in contaminated water must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or gain one level of contamination. A character who drinks contaminated water gains one level of contamination.



[1] Underground Cistern

This subterranean water reservoir is an eighty-foot-tall cylinder with a domed ceiling made from watertight concrete and flagstones. At the top is a five-foot-wide opening that leads to the receptacle fountain in Slaughterstone Square. A narrow five-foot-wide stone walkway is built twenty feet above the cylinder's base and rings a thirty-foot-diameter basin.

[1a] Basin. The reservoir below is almost full, the water line is only two feet below the edge of the walkway. The basin floor is filled with dozens of waterlogged corpses belonging to assorted members of the Hooded Lanterns, Queen's Men, and rival adventurers who ran afoul of the Executioner; their bodies tossed down here by the berserk construct. While most mundane equipment here is ruined, characters can collect a satchel with [[/r 2d6]] delerium fragments inside, and a sack containing coins, gems, and other valuables worth 500 gp. If you wish, you may place [[/r 1d4]] common magic items or a single uncommon magic item here.

  • Two @UUID[Actor.x9AHZBzL0qfZXxBa]{Chuuls} and 12 @UUID[Actor.WRMeQqdgYSpAR9zx]{Aquatic Delerium Dregs} pick over the treasures. If the characters found the cistern on their own, these are the group described in the Adventure Hooks section.

[1b] Aqueduct Passage. Water is siphoned from the basin into this underground aqueduct; the middle of the ten foot diameter opening is roughly in line with the walkway. A barred

grate can be removed with a DC 15 Strength check. Beyond is a barrel-shaped passage flooded to the hip. After it travels two hundred feet, there is a break in the ceiling that opens to the Bathhouse Ruins (below).

[1c] Sewer Canal. The slippery steps descend this wide stairway to the sewer system at large. A battered and broken gate once kept it closed. Where these canals lead is up to you.

[1d] Slaughterstone Stair. This narrow spiral staircase ascends sixty feet to the surface, and ends at a small landing with a short ladder leading to a heavy wrought-iron drainage cover three feet wide. Opening the cover from below requires an action and a DC 15 Strength check. It opens to Slaughterstone Square.

[1e] Smuggler's Tunnel. This wide spiral staircase ascends twenty feet then ends at a small landing leading to a roughly hewn arched tunnel four feet wide and eight feet tall. The passage snakes and twists for some distance before connecting to the basement of the Black Ivory Inn (see Outer City Ruins).

[2] Bathhouse Ruins

This partially-buried rectangular chamber appears to be a bathhouse of the sort built in ancient antiquity. A pillared aisle borders a central pool set with a fine circular fountain decorated with statues of nymphs basking around a long-forgotten god. Bas-relief carvings along the walls depict primordial scenes of storms, shipwrecks, and vengeful aquatic monsters. At one end of the pool is a semicircular alcove where a massive delerium crystal as tall as a human juts through the floor. It is choked by a mass of thick pulsing veins and perspiring strange black nodules laced with prismatic colour. The glowing stone illuminates the room. Opposite the pool is a wide arched canal from which water flows into the chamber. The air is cold and damp, and the sound of running water echoes through the chamber. The vaulted ceiling overhead is cracked and buckling.

  • The statue depicts the old god Nodens, god of sea and storms.
  • Three @UUID[Actor.7WaDpAKH4yXQeYJk]{Sea Hags} - The Chancellor, the Chamberlain, and the Cardinal - are here. They may also be encountered with 10 ([[/r 3d6]]) @UUID[Actor.WRMeQqdgYSpAR9zx]{Aquatic Delerium Dregs} and possibly a @UUID[Actor.x9AHZBzL0qfZXxBa].
  • They are not initially hostile, and instead invite characters to drink contaminated water they have mixed with delerium dust, touch the delerium geode, and then communicate with the Duchess telepathically. The process will undoubtedly bring characters to the brink of a monstrous transformation.
  • Delerium. This is a massive delerium geode cluster. It's exceptionally difficult to remove, but growing around it are [[/r 2d6]] delerium shards that can be more easily harvested. The Duchess' attendants touch the geode when they communicate telepathically with the Duchess, and refer to it as “the Monument of the Duchess.”
  • Treasure. The Chancellor has prominently pinned the @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.items.Item.ChaT000000000016] upon their robes. This valuable item is one the Seals of Drakkenheim. Amongst the urns, bowls, and sacks kept here are [[/r 1d4]] uncommon spell scrolls or potions.

[3] Hydra's Lair

This chamber is the collapsed ruin of a once-magnificent circular bath.

  • A @UUID[Actor.iF30Z7w7lKPbGSDt] dwells here in thrall to the Duchess to serve as a personal guardian. It rarely leaves this chamber except to devour worthless minions.

[4] Underground Lake

This massive cavern is awash in ocatrine light, illuminated by hundreds of tiny delerium crystals embedded in the cavern walls. Water flows from cracks between hanging stalactites, filling the large underground lake with dark water that shimmers and reflects the delerium's sickly light. The air is heavy with moisture, and mucus-like slime washes up on the bank, thick globs of scum cling to the stones. The smallest sound echoes through the chamber with an eerie reverb.

  • The underground lake begins shallow but quickly reaches a depth of thirty feet. The stalactite-covered cavern ceiling is only fifteen feet above the surface.
  • This is the lair of the Duchess. The creature hides beneath the dark water. If it senses hostile intruders, it attempts to lure them close to the banks so it can pull them into the contaminated water easily.
  • If attacked, the Duchess sends out a psychic call to its underlings, and 4 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.1cwfYaACm5F0l4y3] and 12 @UUID[Actor.987Wm71wEZ5XyT1i]{Aquatic Delerium Dregs} arrive five rounds later to help protect the Duchess.
  • Delerium. The cavern walls contain countless small sparkling flakes of delerium, but with several hours of excavation characters can unearth 10 ([[/r 3d6]]) delerium shards and [[/r 1d4]] delerium crystals. Characters inspecting the cavern walls can detect that the delerium crystals are embedded in the rock. There's simply no way these shards came from the meteor, they're too far underground.
  • Below the water's surface is a wide underground river that connects to the Drann River.
  • A mound of loose dirt and sand is not visible above the water's surface, but obvious to any who dive underwater. Digging the mound out takes one minute of work, and contains the Duchess's personal treasure. It contains [[/r 1d4]] delerium crystals, [[/r 1d6]] watertight tubes each containing a rare spell scroll, [[/r 3d6]] other gemstones or treasures worth 250 gp each, and a rare magic item.

Developments

Regardless of whether or not the characters can learn anything from the Duchess, slaying this abomination puts an end to a terrible scourge before it festers and worsens. Left unchecked, the Duchess could become a potential interloper who interferes in future events. Alternatively, the Duchess may decide to pursue its interests elsewhere, leaving Drakkenheim via the contaminated Drann River. It travels downstream towards the ocean and spreads its corrupting influence into the wider world.

The Chancellor's Crest

Characters who recover the @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.items.Item.ChaT000000000016] have a major find. As one of the missing Seals of Drakkenheim, it's one of the keys to the city. Should the Hooded Lanterns and the Queen's Men discover the characters possess it, they'll make overtures to meet them. Both Elias Drexel and the Queen of Thieves use this as an opportunity to recruit the characters to their faction's cause. If the characters turn down the offer, these factions begin drawing up plans to take the @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.items.Item.ChaT000000000016] by stealth, trickery, or even force if necessary.

Queen's Park.name: 女王公园
Queen's Park.text:
Queen's Park

Resting in the northern heart of the city between the Inscrutable Tower and Castle Drakken, Queen's Park was built to honor the Queens of Drakkenheim who ruled as monarchs, but those who were royal consorts have also been commemorated here. Over time, more monuments to other well-known women who defined the history of Drakkenheim were constructed here as well. Commonfolk and nobles alike spoke of fondly losing themselves in Queen's Park as they wandered its elegant beauty on summer afternoons. Now covered by the Deep Haze, one might indeed become lost here forever.

Overview

An expedition to Queen's Park, originally seeking key ingredients for @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.items.Item.AquT000000000001], may eventually lead characters to a shocking discovery regarding the fate of a royal family member.

Adventure Hooks

Gathering Eldritch Lilies. Characters who find the research of Oscar Yoren or hear certain rumours may learn of the magical flowers growing in Queen's Park said to have resistive properties against contamination. Those who research further can learn the following about them:

  • An eldritch lily is a pink-purple flower that grows in pools of contaminated water within natural areas covered by the Deep Haze. The plants have a strange odor, and emit a magical ringing sound audible within ten feet. They register a distinct magical aura when inspected with @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ghXTfe7sgCbgf1Q8]. A single eldritch lily is worth 100 gp. The petals are potent alchemical reagents, and can be used as a component for restorative spells and many potions.

Interactions

While characters explore Queen's Park, they can learn the tragic fate of Queen Lenore von Kessel, and even locate the former royal consort.

The day the meteor fell, chaos erupted in Castle Drakken as the staff and royal family attempted to escape the Haze. At the behest of the royal steward, Queen Lenore's retainers helped her escape Castle Drakken via a secret waterway that exits at Queen's Park. Hindered by Lenore's baggage train, the royal entourage became lost in the spreading mist, and were transformed into monsters. They have remained here ever since, driven to madness with little remaining of their memories.

Lost Lenore

This melancholic creature stands six feet tall with long, thin limbs. Her chalky white skin is cracked and rigid like stone, and her hair is a writhing mass of thick wet tendrils that end in toothy maws. She wears an emerald necklace and a distressed black ball gown. She covers her hair with a shawl and her face with a cracked porcelain mask.

Lenore von Kessel, the Queen-Consort of Drakkenheim and wife of Ulrich IV has become a monster that uses the game statistics of a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.eiifqZwYGi71r2Yl]. Replace the normal Petrifying Gaze trait and actions with the following:

  • Radiant Gaze. When a creature that can see Lenore's eyes starts its turn within 30 feet of her, Lenore can force it to make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw if she isn't incapacitated and can see the creature. The creature takes [[/damage 4d10 radiant average]] damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. In addition, creatures who fail this saving throw gain one level of contamination.
  • Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see Lenore until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at Lenore in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.
  • If Lenore sees herself reflected on a polished surface within 30 feet of her and in an area of bright light, she becomes blinded and incapacitated for [[/r 1d6]] hours.
  • Tentacle Hair. Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or gain one level of contamination.

Transformed by the Haze, Lenore is a mockery of her former self and abhorrently reacts to her own appearance. She dimly remembers seeking shelter in her grotto, but has no recollection of how she escaped the castle.

  • Personality Trait. I speak softly in a perpetual daydream, rhapsodically imagining myself to be in a tragic fairytale while casting others in fictional roles.
  • Ideal. The world is a mirror held up to my own glorious reflection.
  • Bond. I obsessively crave beauty, decadence, and relish in art of all kinds, and especially love my garden and my lilies. They are all I have left.
  • Flaw. I fly into an enraged fury at the sight of my own likeness or the names of my lost family members.

Any character proficient in History can instantly recognize Lenore despite her mutations. Before her transformation, Lenore was extraordinarily vain and narcissistic, though was uncharastically kind and gentle to her servants. She wore outrageously ornamented gowns, hats, makeup, and jewelry, including a famous golden necklace set with eleven emeralds. She loved her children only as extensions of herself, and absolutely despised her husband.

Queen's Retinue

The transformed creatures that once were Lenore's personal attendants each use the game statistics for a @UUID[Actor.DJiIMJZ23efPNZYZ]. Now called the handmaidens, they resemble disheveled and misshapen figures clad in moss-covered petticoats, their hair like slimy grass and skin like knobbly bark.

  • Just as they did in their former lives, these unfortunate wretches attend, obey, and protect Lenore, but have only fragmented memories of their own.
  • They act avoidant, timid, and servile, but are resolute in their duties. They use their abilities to mislead and prevent intruders from reaching the royal grotto while wandering the garden searching for delerium and eldritch lilies to bring back to please Lenore.
  • If interacted with, characters may be able to coax the handmaidens into leading them to the royal grotto by succeeding on three DC 15 Charisma checks, perhaps portraying themselves as valiant knights here to help or conjuring some other fable. Otherwise, characters can follow or chase them back to the royal grotto.

In addition, many of the @UUID[Actor.2z1ZlGCaN2U8uZeP]{Haze Wights} wandering the garden are the undead remnants of the Queen's personal guard, and still bear the crests and livery of House von Kessel.

Area Details

Entering Queen's Park

The labyrinthian footpaths of Queen's Park saunter by baroque-style flower beds in geometrical layouts, down winding paths through forested groves, and over ornamented bridges that cross artificial streams and ponds. The lawns and plazas are decorated with triumphal arches, marble fountains, statuary gardens, and hedge mazes, but the park has become overgrown, desolate, and blanketed by thick glimmering mists. Hardy vines cling to the statues like leeches, and strange flowers in unnatural hues bloom in the gardens. A potent pollen hangs in the air - a smell between musk and sweet perfume. It tingles the nostrils, and irritates the eyes slightly. The garden is quiet, the sounds of footsteps linger loudly. There is no sign of a single animal, not even a bird or rodents, but the plant life flourishes despite the lack of sun and influx of rain.

  • Queen's Park Garden is entirely suffused by the Deep Haze (see chapter 5)

Navigating the Garden

Queen's Park Garden trades the streets, alleys, and ruined buildings of the city proper for footpaths, garden trails, flowerbeds, monuments, and forested groves. As such, characters move through the region just as they do the city streets.

Searching the Garden

Characters looking for an eldritch lily must attempt Searching the Ruins for one hour, as described in “Navigating Drakkenheim” in chapter 5. In addition to making Investigation checks, characters may use Arcana, History, Nature, or Survival to help search the gardens. Success requires a DC 15 check result, with any check result of 20 or higher granting an additional success. What the characters find each attempt is based on their number of successes:

1 success or fewer Nothing
2 successes Brackish Pool
3 successes Eldritch Lily Pond
4 or more successes Royal Grotto

Two or more failed check results triggers one of the random encounters below. Don't forget that characters are exposed to the Deep Haze each hour they spend here!

“Do not, I repeat DO NOT mess with the flower gardens unless you want a lawn gnome's boot to your face.”

— Sebastian Crowe

 

“I've never been into botany but I found those lilies enchanting.”

— Pluto Jackson


Random Encounters in Queen's Park

Check for random encounters as normal as characters explore Queen's Park, using this table to generate encounters.

@Embed[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.tables.RollTable.r2TxhV9HOjVurE3i caption=false rollable]

Brackish pool

This small pond is covered in a thin layer of algae that floats upon the glimmering surface of the water. Amongst the aquatic plant life are three large yellow lilies.

  • Examining the water with a DC10 Investigation check determines that it is contaminated.
  • The three flowers are @UUID[Actor.JOQZAx77IIbznFVO]{Hypnotic Eldritch Blossoms} that attempt to lure characters into the pond.
  • If the water is disturbed, an @UUID[Actor.JU5DYHnBwwFj4jC3] emerges and attacks.

Eldritch Lily Pond

This small artificial pond is surrounded by prismatic cherry blossom trees. Reeds spring up around the muddy bank, and throngs of algae grow beneath the water's surface, which is blanketed with clusters of lily pads. Blooming from the water are several large lily flowers with brightly scintillating pink-purple petals. They emit a sweet strange smell and a melodic arcane hum.

  • Characters find this location with three successful checks when they Search the Garden (see above).
  • Standing in the contaminated water are 5 ([[/r 2d4]]) of the Queen's handmaidens (see Interactions above), gathering the lilies with care to bring back to Lenore in the royal grotto.
  • There are 5 ([[/r 2d4]]) eldritch lilies blooming in the pond, but also 2 ([[/r 1d4]]) @UUID[Actor.JOQZAx77IIbznFVO]{Hypnotic Eldritch Blossoms} (the blossoms ignore the Queen's handmaidens).

Area Details

Characters who search for eldritch lilies and achieve four successes find the royal grotto.



Tiered Garden

This regal garden is decorated with opulent stone staircases with pillared railings that ascend between the tiers. The main garden is highlighted by two large shimmering pools, bordered with tiled stone, while multiple lilies float upon the glistening water, pulsing gently with an eldritch glow. Several gnarled and beautiful cherry blossom trees accent the tiers of the garden in an eternal state of bloom, while petals of hot pink, electric blue, and neon violet fall softly, covering the entire area in waves of colour.

The bubbling of fountains and rustling of wind through trees add a peaceful ambiance to the garden, which is decorated with many statues of a tall woman with elegant limbs wearing outrageous dresses and costumes. The face of each statue has been chiseled off . Centred on the upper tier is a statue of the same figure with a lily in her hand, and like the others the face of the statue has been carved away. Light marble walls separate the tiers and are etched with relief carvings of faces of princesses, queens, maidens and many others who served the von Kessels. Moss, ivy, and unnaturally bright flowers cling to many of the statues and walls. Nestled between the staircases and pools is a set of large beaten brass doors, colour shifted and oxidized by years of wear. The doors have a floral patterned border and two massive handles shaped like lilies. These doors are the entrance to the grotto below.

  • Entering the tiered garden awakens 2 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.gGeLeV411iQ5Yijs]{Shambling Mounds} and [[/r 2d4]] @UUID[Actor.JOQZAx77IIbznFVO]{Hypnotic Eldritch Blossoms} that attempt to lure characters into the contaminated pools.
  • A DC10 History Check by a player proficient in the skill can determine that these statues are all of Lenore von Kessel

“To take a stroll through Queen's Park gardens is to walk the paths of royals past...but even the quickest of trips can leave you one sandwich short of a picnic.”

— Veo Sjena

[1] Grotto Entrance

Descending the stairs leads to a circular vaulted chamber decorated floor to ceiling with mosaics. The geometric patterns depict magical aquatic humanoids such as merfolk, nymphs, and water weirds delightfully relaxing in fantastically extravagant yet everyday activities: playing sports, enjoying meals, taking baths, and cavorting with terrestrial lovers. The chamber is comfortably cool and filled with a pleasant moist odor; the sound of gurgling water echoes down the hall.

In the middle of the chamber is a circular fountain set with a nymph-like figure holding a trident and a vase. Water pours from the opening to fill the fountain with crystal clear water. Around and within the fountain are arranged painted ceramic vases, glass collectables, and loose coins.

The mosaics extend along short hallways leading to the east and west, ending in smaller rooms of similar construction. Arches set with barred iron gates are cut into the walls in three places. Each leads to a roughly hewn and stepped cavernous passage that descends gently while twisting sharply south.

  • A character proficient in mason's tools or with stonecunning can tell the cavernous passages are completely artificial, and not a naturally-formed cavern.
  • 10 ([[/r 3d6]]) handmaidens appear using their @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.DUBgwHPakcLDkB6W] power in the roots within the following chambers and make a last ditch attempt to drive away intruders.

[2] Wellspring

Two yawning stone pipes disgorge streams of sweet-smelling water into a pool in this cavernous chamber. The water is luminescent with a pinkish-purple sheen. Thick roots from the trees above have broken through the walls to sip the collected water. The pond empties gently down a passage that bends southwest.

  • The pool is three feet deep, and the water within is contaminated. The pipe openings are about a foot wide.

[3] Statuary Chamber

The stepped caverns converge in a rectangular chamber. Part of the chamber is finished stonework, the rest remains roughly hewn. Several statues have been carved directly from the rock. The finished chamber contains twenty statues depicting Lenore von Kessel lining the long walls. A large statue of the royal family sits at the end of this chamber, depicting King Ulrich, Queen Lenore, and their two daughters. The faces of any statue depicting Queen Lenore have been sheared off.

  • An inscription on the family monument reads “...for my lovely Lenore, on the anniversary of our royal union.” — King Ulrich von Kessel IV

[4] Underground Pond

An underground pond fills most of this large artificial cavern, filled by a flowing stream to the west. The water glows softly with prismatic light, and across the surface are dozens of purple-pink eldritch lilies. The great roots from the trees above have broken through the ceiling in places to drink deeply from the lambent water.

An exquisitely upholstered velvet chaise lounge with gold-painted armrests and plush pillows is set atop several overlapping woven rugs. Scattered around the furnishings lies the extensive baggage train of a fabulously wealthy noblewoman. A mahogany chest of drawers is overflowing with pompous gowns, fashionable dresses, multicoloured wigs, oversized hats, and fantastically impractical shoes. An oaken coffer is brimming with elaborate jewellery, and several smaller containers, suitcases, and baskets are overstuffed with more clothing, artwork, gems, and coins.

Several portraits and paintings are arranged about the chamber. Many paintings show a noblewoman wearing a golden necklace set with eleven emeralds, but within each the face has been torn off. One painting shows the woman posing with a noble family: a young teen man, two girls - one perhaps eight, the other no more than five - and a portly and bearded man wearing a crown.

  • Lenore resides here. If anyone touches the eldritch lilies or provokes her flaws, she tears away her veil and attacks while prismatic light emanates from her eyes, nose, and mouth.
  • Treasure. Queen Lenore's emerald necklace is worth 10,000 gp. However, the necklace is famous. Anyone with the coinage to buy it knows that it would be immediately recognized as belonging to the royal family. Lenore wears a diamond-set @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.QtmVEreNIWEVOoLR] bearing the royal seal. The other costumes and accoutrements here are mostly ruined, but [[/r 1d4]] pieces worth 250 gp are salvageable. [[/r 1d6]] delerium crystals and [[/r 2d6]] shards can be harvested here.
  • Eldritch Lilies. Lenore's handmaidens have collected 35 ([[/r 10d6]]) eldritch lilies and gathered them in the pool here, but they don't normally grow in this location.

Developments

Characters may have come to Queen's Park seeking flowers, but could leave with a royal problem.

Lenore

Lenore can be kept tranquil or pacified by characters who play into her delusions, or temporarily blinded if she sees her own face. It may be possible to capture her or bring her out of the Garden, but as a contaminated creature she'll die in a few days if taken outside the Haze.

The former Queen is a powerful symbol of the old monarchy. As such, should Elias Drexel and the Hooded Lanterns learn of her survival, they demand Lenore be placed under their custody in the Drakkenheim Garrison. If the characters accept, the Hooded Lanterns reward the characters with an appropriate boon for their deed. This act alone cements the support of the Hooded Lanterns, and they'll look favourably upon an alliance with another faction the characters might be working alongside. However, should the characters refuse, the Hooded Lanterns cast them as royal kidnappers. Elias Drexel expends every effort to rescue Lenore and bring the party to justice.

If Lenore was killed and the characters inform Hooded Lanterns, the soldiers are devastated, but don't seek retribution. They understand the characters did what they had to do against a contaminated monster. Even still, this blunder means Elias Drexel no longer believes the characters have the best interests of Drakkenheim in mind. Unless they prove otherwise through greater deeds, the Hooded Lanterns become ambivalent about working with the party in the future.

Curing Lenore. Unfortunately, the Hooded Lanterns don't possess the means to reverse Lenore's transformation, and must turn to the other factions for help:

  • The Silver Order makes an honest effort to use cleric spells to cure Lenore, but this fails. As such, they suggest a swift and merciful death is the most honorable course for a contaminated creature such as Lenore. They demand the Hooded Lanterns euthanize her as a condition for any future alliance.
  • The Amethyst Academy offers to help find a way to reverse her transformation in return for help retaking the Inscrutable Tower. They suggest the characters seek out the @UUID[Actor.uMQvgbPhxlHLl1vG] to acquire his research. If these works are turned over to the Academy, the mages will aid the characters in developing the @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.spells.Item.SipT000000000011] spell.
  • The @UUID[Actor.k1Me7WfCcgKcAFQe] suspects a wish from the @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.items.Item.CroT000000000022] could be used to cure Lenore, but reveals this information carefully. Naturally, if the Hooded Lanterns keep Lenore in the Drakkenheim Garrison, the Queen's Men stage a kidnapping attempt for ransom!
  • The Followers of the Falling Fire don't care much for the old monarchy, but @UUID[Actor.tqJK1mzxPst0xV08] offers to call upon her divine powers to restore Lenore to her human form. This requires a great show of faith: Lucrecia Mathias only agrees to perform the miracle if Elias Drexel and the Hooded Lanterns leadership agree to join the Followers of the Falling Fire by taking the Sacrament.

Queen-Regent. If her transformation is somehow reversed, Lenore has the statistics of a human noble. While she could possibly take up the throne as a Queen-Regent, this is an extremely dubious claim. Lenore was wed into House von Kessel, and so her political authority comes from her spouse and children. Worse, while Lenore adores the trappings of power and wealth, she loathes actual political responsibility. She wields her influence for personal gain only. Still, she could prove instrumental in confirming the identity of her offspring, but she doesn't know where they are or what happened to them.

Eldritch Lilies and Aqua Expurgo

Creating one dose of @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.items.Item.AquT000000000001] requires alchemical tools and eight hours of work by a character who knows the formula and can cast spells of 3rd level or higher. The recipe calls for one eldritch lily flower, 150 gp in alchemical reagents, and two ounces of blood taken from a contaminated monster.

Oscar Yoren and his apprentices can produce the potion given the materials, as can the Amethyst Academy, the Hooded Lanterns, and the Followers of the Falling Fire if they are given the formula.

Cultivating an Eldritch Lily Garden. Rather than continually revisiting the garden to acquire more flowers, inventive characters might propose creating a garden of their own. Characters who carefully collect two dozen complete eldritch lily plants - not just the flowers - can begin their own plot. They'll need a location within the Haze with ample contaminated water, as eldritch lily plants taken out of the Haze wilt and die within twenty four hours. The strongholds of the Followers of the Falling Fire and the Hooded Lanterns, as well as Reed Manor, are suitable sites for a safely accessible lily garden, but the Amethyst Academy has the means to create one at their remote strongholds as well.

This ensures a consistent supply of reagents for crafting @UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.items.Item.AquT000000000001], and working with a faction or Oscar Yoren allows each character to receive one dose at the outset of any mission. Characters who wish to create additional doses must either do so themselves or provide extra gold and materials to ensure the garden isn't overfarmed.

The Steward's Letter

Your Majesty,

Please excuse the haste of this missive, and the messenger who bears it. Our present circumstances are both dire and desperate.

I have charged this man with ensuring your safety during this calamity. He is a valiant knight, and will escort you and your handmaids out of Drakkenheim. It is imperative you flee the castle immediately via the garden passage.

Do not return to the royal apartments, nor take the main castle gate.

I beg you, your Majesty, do not wait for anyone else, nor burden yourself with trinkets and treasures, nor tarry in the gardens! Escape the city with all speed.

I promise, my queen, I shall not leave myself without the king and your son. I pray that your daughters remain safe. We shall all meet again in health and mirth soon.

Yours in faithful service,

Johann Eisner, Royal Steward

Rose Theatre.name: 玫瑰剧院
Rose Theatre.text:
玫瑰剧院

德拉肯海姆的剧院在被完全烧毁前通常只存在了几十年，而玫瑰剧院则是德拉肯海姆众多剧院中最新的一座。这座三层楼高的环形剧场拥有伸展式的舞台和露天的观众席，这里曾是这座城市的娱乐中心。密密麻麻的普通人民在这里观看庸俗的喜剧、夸张血腥的历史剧以及由竞争激烈的吟游诗人们所著的戏剧悲剧。如今，它被遗弃在了污霭之中，笑声、乐声和掌声早已不再。

总览

在这场冒险中，角色们要探索神秘的玫瑰剧院，它被一道无形的屏障诡异地与城市废墟相隔开，而由未受污染的元素生物和奥术构装体保护了起来。角色们会在这里遭遇@UUID[Actor.8mw3Q1D3NIIXIlSg]{瑞安·格雷梅尔}，一位离开了紫晶学院的天才@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.B7lBOr1AahNZs4a6]{大法师}。虽然她被打上了叛道法师的印记，但瑞安·格雷梅尔并不像@UUID[Actor.jfJGagVOoUgyCyxn]{奥斯卡·约伦}和@UUID[Actor.uMQvgbPhxlHLl1vG]{苍白之人}那样使用污染法术。相反，她制作了一套可以抵御污染的强大魔法护甲。

角色们将决定如何与她互动。他们可以杀死她，夺走她的魔法物品，抢走她的魔法书，但也可以通过与她交涉获得更多好处。他们甚至可以促成一项协议，令她重返紫晶学院。

冒险引子

危险想法。 瑞安·格雷梅尔进入紫晶学院的视野中已有一段时间了。虽然她是@UUID[Actor.IFRQ1jK41KOQNjGl]{埃德瑞克·符文织者}的挚友，但同时也是他的劲敌。他们想知道她想在废墟中做什么，以及她的研究发现了妄质的什么秘密。

误入歧途的法师。 白银骑士团希望将她绳之以法。作为一个背弃了《炉明法令》的魔法学者，白银骑士团认为他们有义务摧毁她的研究，并将瑞安·格雷梅尔送入监狱，但如果玩家能直接击败她，他们也同样高兴。

互动

瑞安·格雷梅尔会主动对付那些闯入玫瑰剧院的入侵者，但她会倾向于优先让那些入侵者陷入失能，这样她就能知道他们为什么会出现在那里。由于她独自躲在内城的魔法防御系统中，她会认为任何能够穿过魔法屏障的人都是紫晶学院派来杀她的刺客。但是，如果入侵者试图和她交涉，她也会手下留情，但她会在被擒前尝试逃走。

瑞安·格雷梅尔

瑞安·格雷梅尔曾在紫晶学院中备受尊敬，她的开创性研究促成了许多对于妄质的早期发现，她还为学院设计了许多工序规程，让学院得以使用水晶来制作魔法物品。然而，她提出了一个极其夸张的计划，让紫晶学院以武力公然夺取德拉肯海姆的控制权，这一计划震惊了学院理事会。这样的行为严重僭越了《炉明法令》，但格雷梅尔则轻描淡写地回应道，王国和神职人员已经无法真正意义上地执行法令了。结果，她被打上了叛道的印记，学院也不再承认她的身份，最具侮辱性的是，理事会还抢走了她的研究成果归功于自己。她逃进了德拉肯海姆，现在正打算进入莫测之塔，并在私下继续她的研究。

瑞安·格雷梅尔是个 40 多岁的人类女性。她从头到脚都穿有护甲，身着白色的长袍，她幽灵般的外貌也使她获得了“钢铁女妖”的称号。

  • 特质。对我感兴趣的话题开门见山，否则就别浪费我的时间。

  • 理想。只有法师才能揭开妄质的神秘面纱，并保护世界不受污霭的侵袭，但如果我们受到《炉明法令》的阻碍就无法实现这一点。

  • 牵绊。我很想念我在紫晶学院中的朋友与同事，但我对理事会对待我的方式感到愤怒。

  • 缺陷。我不会把时间浪费在那些想恢复无聊的君主制的马屁精身上。

瑞安·格雷梅尔

瑞安·格雷梅尔是一名人类@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.B7lBOr1AahNZs4a6]{大法师}她身穿@UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.items.Item.HazT000000000008]{污霭行者板甲}、飞翼之靴，还带着一根@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.bPFVfq81EsMNu6OQ]{闪电束魔杖}除去她已准备的法术，她的法术书中还包含@UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.spells.Item.PurT000000000008]{祛除污染}，@UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.spells.Item.RidT000000000009]{驱隙电闪}以及@UUID[Compendium.drakkenheim-core.spells.Item.OctT000000000007]{第八虹光喷射}。

于污霭中生存 。瑞安·格雷梅尔每天都会使用@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.pn4SnsFDvYDiE6rC]来为自己创造一个安全的休息地点。她在剧院里没有固定的生活区域。

被束缚的元素。瑞安·格雷梅尔的元素是通过法术@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.42O2aNBW7vK90gTL]召唤出来为她服务的，它们会绝对地服从于她。

区域详述

进入

玫瑰剧院是一座环形的三层木制剧场，中央有着露天的观众席。

力场屏障

整座剧院都被一块巨型妄质晶簇产生的半球形@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.o9ZCvuD2B1OTcubb]{力场墙}保护了起来。这道屏障包围了整座建筑，其边际延伸出剧院外墙大约 20 尺，高于剧院顶部约 50 尺。
